review: Very misleading.  They get you with the Google name, price, and 3-easy-step setup.  Easy? - I'm above-average in solving my pc problems, and spent too much time reading their massive online troubleshooter regarding the problems with my Verizon FIOS router (pretty common router for Google's product designers to screw-up this "handshaking" of hardware).  I sure got fooled! - don't be their next fool.  If Google wants ChromeCast to succeed, wait a few years for them to work the bugs out, and keep checking user reviews.  For now, you'd have to agonize over all the bugs yourself.After removing it from my TV to prepare it for return . . . my TV (4 years old) no longer picks up channels.  I had the TV auto-reprogram its channels, and all I'm seeing is snow on the screen.  Judge for yourself, product review readers.  I rarely write reviews, but sure hope this helps some of you.  10% of the reviews are 1-star, which for me is pretty bad.
